chapter.title: Customizing and Adjustments
chapter.para: The behaviour of GeneSEZ can be customized in various way and some customizations need a special setup.

listitem.para: Use an eclipse class folder (i.e. the folders content is accessible by java class path lookup) in your generator project, name it something like customization and place all your advice scripts and templates (Xtend and Xpand AOP) there. For java based adjustments use an additional source folder. Ensure the correct file encoding!

You can even put scripts and templates provided by GeneSEZ there and adjust it to your needs in case you don't like AOP or AOP is not sufficient. Doing so ensure your class folder (and maybe source folder) appears before the Plug-In dependencies in the class path order (right click on your project, select Build Path » Configure Build Path..., go to the tab Order and Export).

You can place the GeneSEZ plug-ins containing the behaviour you want to adjust into your workspace even if you have installed GeneSEZ. The plug-ins in your workspace are then used instead of the installed ones. Note that you do not have to put all plug-in projects in your workspace.
You place the GeneSEZ plug-ins into your workspace and adjust them as you need. Note to keep track of your changes to avoid a merge nightmare when you update the GeneSEZ plug-ins of a future version.

chapter.para: Consider the plug-ins to be placed in the workspace carefully. Platform and adapter projects can be usually simply placed there without any further doing. In case of meta model projects you clearly have to build the meta model by yourself. For eclipse integration projects you need to start a runtime eclipse to reflect the changes.

term.emphasis: Placing some Plug-In Projects into the Workspace

listitem.para: You need to have GeneSEZ installed. Use our repository to checkout the projects you need ( and may help identifying it). Ensure to choose versions compatible to your installed GeneSEZ version!
You need to build the meta model projects if you place them in the workspace. To build them you need the project within your workspace.
Configure the build project by creating the file build/environment.properties. You can use build/environment.properties.template as basis. You need to care about the following properties:
Specifies the eclipse home directory, i.e. the directory where eclipse.exe or eclipse is located.
Specifies the home directory of magic draw, i.e. the directory where magic draw is installed or unpacked to.
All other properties you can leave at their default value.

After configuration you can build any (meta model) project in your workspace. Go to the build directory of your project, right click on the file build.xml and select Run As » Ant Build.... Go to the JRE tab and choose the entry Run in same JRE as the workspace and click Run to start execution.

Note the build script calls the java compiler to compile source files. If your JAVA_HOME is pointing to an JRE you will get an error result. In this case make sure eclipse compiles the newly source files before you proceed.

section.title: Source Code Repository Layout
section.para: GeneSEZ currently uses a subversion repository with the following layout:

listitem.para: The main development of GeneSEZ occurs here. Do not expect that this version is always runnable.
All releases are available as tag.
For some development efforts we decide to use branches but usually we get along without one.
Currently the place for projects supporting GeneSEZ where the sources aren't part of the GeneSEZ plugins.
The place for all GeneSEZ example projects.
The place for all outdated and discontinued stuff.
